Description: Fragment preserving whole profile (mended from two sherds) of probably North Ionian pottery plate with ledge rim; light orange clay with silver mica; exterior: painted bands; ring foot glazed, underside reserved as far as preserved; interior: hook maeander frieze between bands on rim; in outer band on bowl, solid tongues alternating with vertical rows of dots; in tondo: floral pattern (?).
Bibliographic references: Price 1924 / Pottery of Naukratis (pl. VII, no. 5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.755)
